sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: The Wall Street Journal calls on Moscow to release its reporter denying Russia's claims he was spying for the US government.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: In a first keynote speech on EU-China relations, Ursula von der Leyen says Beijing is becoming more oppressive at home and more assertive abroad.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: The head of the IAEA says he wants Russia and Ukraine to agree to a local ceasefire, preventing a potential catastrophe at the Zaporizhzhia nuclear plant.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: EU negotiators reach a deal to double the use of energy from renewable sources by 2030.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: A correspondent for the American newspaper, The Wall Street Journal,

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: has been arrested in Russia on charges of espionage.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: A court in Moscow reportedly authorized Evan Gershkoivich's detention in Yekaterinburg, east of the Ural Mountains.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Reporters without borders say Gershkoivich, who is a U.S. citizen, was investigating the private military Wagner Group.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: But the Kremlin maintains he was spying for the US government.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: The Federal Security Bureau claims that Gershkoivich was gathering secret information on Russia's military industrial complex.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: The Wall Street Journal denies the allegations and said he was engaged in, quote, normal journalistic activity.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: The publication has demanded the immediate release of the journalist who faces up to 20 years in prison.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Europe must be tougher on China. That's the assessment of European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen, who described Beijing on Thursday as becoming more repressive at home and more assertive abroad. Ahead of a trip to the Chinese capital with French President Emmanuel Macron next week, she set the tone during a speech in Brussels for what she's calling the new era on EU-China relations. I believe it is neither viable nor in Europe's interest to decouple from China.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Our relations are not black or white, and our response cannot be either.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: This is why we need to focus on de-risk, not decouple.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The visit comes following a high-level meeting between Chinese President Xi Jinping and Russia's Vladimir Putin in Moscow, as concerns grow that Beijing may provide support for the Kremlin's war in Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Any peace plan which would, in effect, consolidate Russian annexations is simply not a viable plan.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: We have to be frank on this point.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: How China continues to interact with Putin's war will be a determining factor for EU-China relations going forward.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: One key point of the European Commission president is that China wants to use Russia's current weakness to grow its own geopolitical strength and influence, and that Moscow is increasingly becoming the junior partner in the relationship.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: It is clear from this visit that China sees Putin's weakness as a way to increase its leverage over Russia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: And it is clear that the power balance in that relationship, which for most of the last century favored Russia, has now reversed.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Miko Huatari, who runs a European think tank that's been sanctioned by China, says that the EU needs to adjust to a more bipolar world. But it must do so on its own terms. MALCOLM BRABANT, MECO HUTARI, WHO RUNS A EUROPEAN THINK TANK THAT'S BEEN SANCTIONED BY CHINA, SAYS THAT THE E.U. NEEDS TO ADJUST TO A MORE BIPOLAR WORLD, BUT IT MUST DO SO ON ITS OWN TERMS.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: MECO HUTARI, MECO HUTARI, WHO RUNS A EUROPEAN THINK TANK THAT'S BEEN SANCTIONED BY CHINA, SAYS THAT THE E.U. NEEDS TO ADJUST TO A MORE BIPOLAR WORLD, BUT IT MUST DO SO ON ITS OWN TERMS.

sentences.sentence: MECO HUTARI, MECO HUTARI, WHO RUNS A EUROPEAN THINK TANK THAT'S BEEN SANCTIONED BY CHINA, SAYS THAT THE E.U. NEEDS TO ADJUST TO A MORE BIPOLAR WORLD, BUT IT MUST DO SO ON ITS OWN TERMS.

sentences.sentence: MECO HUTARI, MECO HUTARI, WHO RUNS A EUROPEAN THINK TANK THAT'S BEEN SANCTIONED BY CHINA, SAYS THAT THE E.U. NEEDS TO ADJUST TO A MORE BIPOLAR WORLD, BUT IT MUST DO SO ON ITS OWN TERMS.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: MECO HUTARI, MECO HUTARI, WHO RUNS A EUROPEAN THINK TANK THAT'S BEEN SANCTIONED BY CHINA, SAYS THAT THE E.U. NEEDS TO ADJUST TO A MORE BIPOLAR WORLD, BUT IT MUST DO SO ON ITS OWN TERMS. MECO HUTARI, MECO HUTARI, WHO RUNS A EUROPEAN around by others to tell us what we need to do in this space, it's better for us to define the terms of our engagement. Do you have time?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Well, it's a very urgent business indeed. There are risks that will probably increase.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Our dependence is extremely high in certain aspects and the geopolitical tensions around China are increasing. So it's an urgent business, but at the same time, let's do it properly and not overreact.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: von der Leyen also says that the EU needs to reassess a landmark investment agreement negotiated with China that's been put on ice since 2021 due to a number of ruptures in the relationship.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: The head of the UN's nuclear watchdog agency says he is working on a security plan

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: for the Moscow-controlled Zaporizhzhia nuclear plant.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: The facility has been subject to numerous attacks since Russia's full-scale invasion of Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: During a visit, Rafael Grossi says he wants Russia and Ukraine to find common ground.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: The idea is to agree on certain principles, certain commitments, including not to attack the plant, for example, and some others.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: certain commitments, including not to attack the plant, for example, and some others.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Grossi has been calling for months to elaborate a ceasefire agreement for the area around the nuclear plant.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Both sides blame the other for attacks on the site.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Ukraine has accused Russia of using the facility for military activity and is demanding the removal of armed personnel from the plant.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Moscow insists it should keep its forces there to protect the world from nuclear catastrophe.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: A Russian man convicted in abstentia over social media posts

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: criticising the war in Ukraine has been arrested in Belarus.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Alexei Moskaliov fled house arrest before the court in Yefremov delivered its verdict.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The 54-year-old single father was arrested by Belarusian police near the capital Minsk at the request of the Russian authorities, Belarusian officials said.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The case began in early March, when Moskaliov's 13-year-old daughter drew an anti-war picture at school.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The principal immediately alerted the police and the child was placed in a home, while the father was placed under house arrest.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Dozens of schools across Bulgaria have been closed for three days following bomb threats made via email and phone.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Students had to be evacuated and police stepped in to search the buildings for explosives.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: No bombs have been found so far.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The motive is unclear, but with schools used as polling stations, the disruption may be linked to Bulgaria's general election on Sunday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Most threats were made to schools in the capital Sofia and in the Black Sea ports of Varna and Burgas.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The Vatican says that Pope Francis is gradually improving after he was admitted to hospital with a respiratory infection on Wednesday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: His hospitalisation raised fresh concerns over the health of the 86-year-old pontiff, who suffers from a number of medical conditions.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: But the latest update from Vatican spokesperson, Matteo Bruni, confirmed that Pope Francis had resumed his work while his treatment continues. Our correspondent, Georgia Orlandi, has more from Rome.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: The Vatican also said that the pope is touched by the many messages he received. Now, the pope's latest hospitalization, we know that he's been treated several times already, comes ahead on Palm Sunday, on April the 2nd, which marks the start of one of the busiest times of year for the Pope, filled with lots of ceremonies leading to Easter Sunday on April the 9th. Francis will be replaced. Last year he was replaced at some point as he could not lead ceremonies due to a problem to his knee. So we'll find out later on whether or not planned treatments will have to continue and whether or not he will have to be replaced.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Giorgio Orlandi for UN News in Rome.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The share of renewables in the European Union must double by 2030, after the European Parliament

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: and member states reached an agreement on Thursday which says that 42.5 percent of energy must come from clean sources.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Governments will be able to push this target to 45 percent if they wish to do so.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: In the European Parliament, the MEP leading negotiations on the issue says the deal is deliberately flexible in its objectives.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: It also provides EU countries with the means to accelerate the construction of the necessary infrastructure for wind, solar and hydrogen. We now say to the member states, you have 12 months for a solar park or a wind park, and if this solar park is within 12 months not granted, then it's automatically granted.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: We call it positive silence, and I think this is a wonderful instrument to speed up the permitting procedures in member states.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The long and looming shadow of nuclear power hangs over the agreement, though.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: France, the main champion of nuclear energy, says the deal will help with the production of low-carbon hydrogen.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: But in the European Parliament, MEPs say the agreement means something completely different.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: In parliament, MEPs say the agreement means something completely different.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The French did not win today.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: They wanted to have renewable energies and nuclear energy at the same level.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: They did not win today, but I believe they will fight in every other dossier and this will be an ongoing conflict.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Biomass, which involves burning organic matter, has also been given a green stamp of approval.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Environmental NGOs say this is regrettable, though, since the use of wood to produce energy risks having an impact on forests which capture CO2 and represent an essential space for biodiversity.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The agreement must now be formally adopted by MEPs and EU member states.
